name: Fields, Appellant, v. James B. Sipe & Company
name_abbreviation: Fields v. James B. Sipe & Co.

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Fields, Appellant, v. James B. Sipe & Company.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
This appeal is ruled by Gianni v. Russell, 281 Pa. 320, in which the questions involved were practically identical with those now before us. The decision in that case was adverse to appellant’s contention here.
The judgment of the court below is affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Karl E. Weise, with him Allen G. Lynch and Harold B. Stadtfeld, for appellant.
O. K. Price, with him Robert A. Applegate and Rose & Eichenauer, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Fields, Appellant, v. James B. Sipe & Company.
November 25, 1935:
Argued October 16, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Kephart, Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
Karl E. Weise, with him Allen G. Lynch and Harold B. Stadtfeld, for appellant.
O. K. Price, with him Robert A. Applegate and Rose & Eichenauer, for appellee.
